What could we improve: The ordering and shipping experience were fine, and met my expectations. The delivery was frustrating and unsatisfactory. UPS mail innovations has caused delays in the delivery of our book boxes more than once, but this time it was extremely slow. Tracking information showed that our book box was in Denver (our town, same as delivery address) beginning Tuesday, Dec. 13, “pending acceptance.” On Thursday, Dec. 15, that had not changed, so I went to the post office to inquire about it. The clerk told me it wasn’t there, in spite of the tracking info to the contrary. He said as soon as they received it and checked it in, it would be out for delivery. On Friday the 16th, the tracking info showed it was out for delivery. On Saturday the 17th, I received an email saying it had been delivered. Monday the 19th, I checked with one of our administrators, and she said they had checked the mailbox earlier that morning but there was no mail. I went to the mailbox after that, and found our book box, along with other mail. I was very relieved to see it on Monday, since Tuesday the 20th was our last day of school, and I had two families waiting for books. UPS service is usually timely and reliable. When the post office is involved, the quality of service declines. I am disappointed about that, because I want the USPS to be timely and reliable, but they’re not. I recognize that there may be increased cost associated with using UPS to deliver all the way to the customer, and I understand the need to reduce costs. I just want you to be aware that reducing the financial cost of delivery also carries a reduction in the quality of service to your customers.

I understand the holidays being a busier time of year with deliveries, but I was putting my trust in this company to follow through with their word, and once again, I was let down by a business that holds themselves very highly and left to deal with the added stress of communicating to upset parents as to why their Christmas presents for their family members had not arrived yet.   I did reach out to customer service and they were able to resend my package which came the last day of school before vacation. This was a half day and the package did not arrive until mid afternoon when the students had already been dismissed and I had left the building for the week. Customer service did provide me with a variety of coupon codes that I'm not quite sure how to use which I admit was kind, but I just want this business to understand the impact they have and the impact of their words.  I know now that words mean very little and will only be focusing on actions to show what is meaningful and important to this company.
